title: Web3Privacy Prague 2023
desc: June 5, 2023 - A lunarpunk conference focused on privacy in the Web3 industry as a complement to the Web3Privacy Now research.
license: This web is built with [SvelteKit](https://kit.svelte.dev/) and is [open-source](https://github.com/web3privacy/w3ps1) under CC0 license
slogan: Diving into the culture of the Web3 privacy industry
intro_first: If privacy is a human right, then we need to protect it.
intro:
Privacy advocates worldwide are coming together to discuss how to mainstream privacy within the Web3 industry. So it will become a cultural phenomenon embodying both decentralisation & anti-surveillance capitalism practices.

The conference complements the research projects [Web3Privacy Now](http://web3privacy.info/) and was created by joining forces with the production team of the privacy hackathon [ETHBrno](https://ethbrno.cz/).

Part of [Prague Blockchain Week 2023](http://prgblockweek.com/).

themes.title: Regulations vs Privacy
themes.desc: 2023 will be a year of privacy regulations. Privacy coins will be banned, mixer's team become anon etc. How do we defend our rights for privacy?

themes.title: MAINSTREAM ON-CHAIN PRIVACY
themes.desc: Majority of privacy services are tech oriented. It's hard to use them among non-technical people. What should industry do help people onboard into privacy with ease?

themes.title: Human rights DAOs (pro-privacy)
themes.desc: How privacy-enhancing tools could protect DAOs working within non-democratic countries.

themes.title: Identity (ID)
themes.desc: Decentralised identity is the key to Web3, but at the same time to KYC & AML. Ethical way of building DID without embedded surveillence logic.

themes.title: Full-Stack Privacy
themes.desc: Full-Stack Privacy is achievable if we ensivion one. Combining both on-chain & off-chain privacy.

themes.title: Private messaging protocols
themes.desc: We need resilient privacy-preserving, p2p communication layers for Web3, that allows free and uncensored human-to-human, machine-to-machine or hybrid communication.

themes.title: Lunarpunk vs Solarpunk
themes.desc: For solarpunk to succeed it must integrate the lunarpunk unconscious. The only hope for solarpunk is to [go dark](https://www.egirlcapital.com/writings/107533289). Do you agree?

themes.title: R&D: ZK, MPC, THE
themes.desc: There are many different cryptography technics for privacy preservation. How to balance them all & avoid 1-tool chokepoint?

themes.title: Privacy readiness levels
themes.desc: Introduction of the privacy scoring mechanism to help non-tech people understand security level of the solution

themes.title: Privacy wars
themes.desc: Why are privacy-blockchain socials so toxic? How could we stop hating each other & work together

themes.title: Privacy activism
themes.desc: Mapping down tools to protect privacy industry: from builders like Alexey Pertsev to projects.

themes.title: Network states (with a privacy focus)
themes.desc: Time to imagine the network state-as-a-grassroots movement for privacy, freedom & better future.

faq.title: What is Web3Privacy Now?
faq.text: [Web3privacy now](http://web3privacy.info/) is a research project aimed at building a culture of privacy industry in web3: the most extensive database of privacy-enhancing solutions, the framework for PEDApps ideation, use-cases database & many more.

faq.title: What is Prague Blockchain Week?
faq.text: [Prague Blockchain Week 2023](http://prgblockweek.com/) (#PBW23) is a decentralized gathering of all people interested in cryptocurrencies and related topics. It consists of many independent events across Jun 2 - 11, including conferences, hackathons, workshops, community meetups, as well as various parties and happy hours.

faq.title: Who is the event for?
faq.text: Our event is for 300 people interested in privacy topics in the Web3 industry. We aim to make our content accessible to everyone - rather than going into deep technical detail, we'll discuss privacy topics in their broader context.

faq.title: When will tickets go on sale? What will be the payment options?
faq.text: Tickets will go on sale in April 2023. Payment will be possible via credit card, Bitcoin (on-chain), Lightning Network or possibly other cryptocurrencies.

faq.title: Do you offer any discounts?
faq.text: Yes, we do! We offer discounted tickets (up to 100%!) for independent developers, students and especially active privacy advocates or open-source contributors to private protocols or tools. If you are interested in a discount, please fill out [this form](https://attend.web3privacy.info).

faq.title: How do I get to the venue?
faq.text: Venue X10 (full name "[Divadlo X10](https://divadlox10.cz)") is located in the centre of Prague near the metro station *NÃ¡rodnÃ­ TÅ™Ã­da* (Line B) and *MÅ¯stek* (Line A,C). The address is [CharvÃ¡tova 10/39, Prague 1, 110 00](https://goo.gl/maps/Yh8qWagnqB1DvK676) ([Google Maps](https://goo.gl/maps/Yh8qWagnqB1DvK676), [OpenStreetMap](https://www.openstreetmap.org/node/10308561358)).

faq.title: Will the talks be livestreamed and/or recorded?
faq.text: Yes, we're planning both. A livestream of the conference and recordings of the talks and panels will be publicly available after the conference.

faq.title: I have another question, where can I contact you?
faq.text: You can contact the organizing team or the community around the event in our public Matrix space or Signal group: [chat.web3privacy.info](https://chat.web3privacy.info/)

speakersNote: We keep adding more and more speakers, stay tuned ...
programNote: WIP. The final schedule will be published a few weeks before the conference in May 2023.

main.title: Welcome to Web3Privacy
main.desc: Welcoming visitors to our private-centric research, community and conference

main.title: #Lunarpunk party
main.desc: Enjoy our afterparty in Lunarpunk style with quality Prague rave DJs, which will take place in the same venue until the morning (4am).
